00002 
00003 /***************************************************************************/
00004 /* RSC IDENTIFIER: UTM
00005  *
00006  * ABSTRACT
00007  *
00008  *    This component provides conversions between geodetic coordinates
00009  *    (latitude and longitudes) and Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM)
00010  *    projection (zone, hemisphere, easting, and northing) coordinates.
00011  *
00012  * ERROR HANDLING
00013  *
00014  *    This component checks parameters for valid values.  If an invalid value
00015  *    is found, the error code is combined with the current error code using
00016  *    the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error codes to be
00017  *    returned. The possible error codes are:
00018  *
00019  *          UTM_NO_ERROR           : No errors occurred in function
00020  *          UTM_LAT_ERROR          : Latitude outside of valid range
00021  *                                    (-80.5 to 84.5 degrees)
00022  *          UTM_LON_ERROR          : Longitude outside of valid range
00023  *                                    (-180 to 360 degrees)
00024  *          UTM_EASTING_ERROR      : Easting outside of valid range
00025  *                                    (100,000 to 900,000 meters)
00026  *          UTM_NORTHING_ERROR     : Northing outside of valid range
00027  *                                    (0 to 10,000,000 meters)
00028  *          UTM_ZONE_ERROR         : Zone outside of valid range (1 to 60)
00029  *          UTM_HEMISPHERE_ERROR   : Invalid hemisphere ('N' or 'S')
00030  *          UTM_ZONE_OVERRIDE_ERROR: Zone outside of valid range
00031  *                                    (1 to 60) and within 1 of 'natural' zone
00032  *          UTM_A_ERROR            : Semi-major axis less than or equal to zero
00033  *          UTM_INV_F_ERROR        : Inverse flattening outside of valid range
00034  *                                    (250 to 350)
00035  *
00036  * REUSE NOTES
00037  *
00038  *    UTM is intended for reuse by any application that performs a Universal
00039  *    Transverse Mercator (UTM) projection or its inverse.
00040  *
00041  * REFERENCES
00042  *
00043  *    Further information on UTM can be found in the Reuse Manual.
00044  *
00045  *    UTM originated from :  U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center
00046  *                           Geospatial Information Division
00047  *                           7701 Telegraph Road
00048  *                           Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00049  *
00050  * LICENSES
00051  *
00052  *    None apply to this component.
00053  *
00054  * RESTRICTIONS
00055  *
00056  *    UTM has no restrictions.
00057  *
00058  * ENVIRONMENT
00059  *
00060  *    UTM was tested and certified in the following environments:
00061  *
00062  *    1. Solaris 2.5 with GCC, version 2.8.1
00063  *    2. MSDOS with MS Visual C++, version 6
00064  *
00065  * MODIFICATIONS
00066  *
00067  *    Date              Description
00068  *    ----              -----------
00069  *    2-27-07          Original C++ Code
00070  *
00071  */
00072 
00073

00077  */

00090  *    UTM.h         - Defines the function prototypes for the utm module.
00091  *    TransverseMercator.h    - Is used to convert transverse mercator coordinates
00092  *    MapProjectionCoordinates.h   - defines map projection coordinates
00093  *    UTMCoordinates.h   - defines UTM coordinates
00094  *    GeodeticCoordinates.h   - defines geodetic coordinates
00095  *    CoordinateConversionException.h - Exception handler
00096  *    ErrorMessages.h  - Contains exception messages
00097  */

00105  *                              DEFINES
00106  */
00107 
00108 #define EPSILON 1.75e-7   /* approx 1.0e-5 degrees (~1 meter) in radians */
00109 
00110 const double PI = 3.14159265358979323e0;         /* PI                        */
00111 const double PI_OVER_180 = 3.14159265358979323e0 / 180.0;         /* PI                        */
00112 const double MIN_LAT = ( (-80.5 * PI) / 180.0 ); /* -80.5 degrees in radians    */
00113 const double MAX_LAT = ( (84.5 * PI) / 180.0 );  /* 84.5 degrees in radians     */
00114 const double MIN_EASTING = 100000.0;
00115 const double MAX_EASTING = 900000.0;
00116 const double MIN_NORTHING = 0.0;
00117 const double MAX_NORTHING = 10000000.0;
00118

00120 /************************************************************************/
00121 /*                              FUNCTIONS
00122  *
00123  */
00124 
00125 UTM::UTM( double ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis, double ellipsoidFlattening, long override ) :
00126   CoordinateSystem(),
00127   UTM_Override( 0 )
00128 {
00129 /*
00130  * The constructor receives the ellipsoid parameters and
00131  * UTM zone override parameter as inputs, and sets the corresponding state
00132  * variables.  If any errors occur, an exception is thrown with a description 
00133  * of the error.
00134  *
00135  *    ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis        : Semi-major axis of ellipsoid, in meters       (input)
00136  *    ellipsoidFlattening           : Flattening of ellipsoid                       (input)
00137  *    override                      : UTM override zone, zero indicates no override (input)
00138  *    errorStatus                   : Error status                                  (output)
00139  */
00140 
00141   double inv_f = 1 / ellipsoidFlattening;
00142   char errorStatus[500] = "";
00143 
00144   if (ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis <= 0.0)
00145   { /* Semi-major axis must be greater than zero */
00146     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::semiMajorAxis );
00147   }
00148   if ((inv_f < 250) || (inv_f > 350))
00149   { /* Inverse flattening must be between 250 and 350 */
00150     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::ellipsoidFlattening );
00151   }
00152   if ((override < 0) || (override > 60))
00153   {
00154     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::zoneOverride );
00155   }
00156 
00157   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00158     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00159 
00160   semiMajorAxis = ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis;
00161   flattening = ellipsoidFlattening;
00162 
00163   UTM_Override = override;
00164 
00165   double centralMeridian;
00166   double originLatitude = 0;
00167   double falseEasting = 500000;
00168   double falseNorthing = 0;
00169   double scale = 0.9996;
00170   
00171   for(int zone = 1; zone <= 60; zone++)
00172   {
00173     if (zone >= 31)
00174       centralMeridian = ((6 * zone - 183) * PI_OVER_180);
00175     else
00176       centralMeridian = ((6 * zone + 177) * PI_OVER_180);
00177     
00178    transverseMercatorMap[zone] = new TransverseMercator(semiMajorAxis, flattening, centralMeridian, originLatitude, falseEasting, falseNorthing, scale);
00179   }
00180 }
00181 
00182 
00183 UTM::UTM( const UTM &u )
00184 {
00185   int zone = 1;
00186   std::map< int, TransverseMercator* > tempTransverseMercatorMap = u.transverseMercatorMap;
00187   std::map< int, TransverseMercator* >::iterator _iterator = tempTransverseMercatorMap.begin();
00188   while( _iterator != tempTransverseMercatorMap.end() && zone <= 60 )
00189   {
00190     transverseMercatorMap[zone] = new TransverseMercator( *_iterator->second );
00191     zone++;
00192   }
00193 
00194   semiMajorAxis = u.semiMajorAxis;
00195   flattening = u.flattening;
00196   UTM_Override = u.UTM_Override;
00197 }
00198 
00199 
00200 UTM::~UTM()
00201 {
00202         while( transverseMercatorMap.begin() != transverseMercatorMap.end() )
00203         {
00204                 delete ( ( *transverseMercatorMap.begin() ).second );
00205                 transverseMercatorMap.erase( transverseMercatorMap.begin() );
00206         }
00207 }

00209 
00210 UTM& UTM::operator=( const UTM &u )
00211 {
00212   if( this != &u )
00213   {
00214     int zone = 1;
00215     std::map< int, TransverseMercator* > tempTransverseMercatorMap = u.transverseMercatorMap;
00216     std::map< int, TransverseMercator* >::iterator _iterator = tempTransverseMercatorMap.begin();
00217     while( _iterator != tempTransverseMercatorMap.end() && zone <= 60 )
00218     {
00219       transverseMercatorMap[zone]->operator=( *_iterator->second );
00220       zone++;
00221     }
00222 
00224     semiMajorAxis = u.semiMajorAxis;
00225     flattening = u.flattening;
00226     UTM_Override = u.UTM_Override;
00227   }
00228 
00229   return *this;
00230 }

00233 UTMParameters* UTM::getParameters() const
00234 {
00235 /*
00236  * The function getParameters returns the current ellipsoid
00237  * parameters and UTM zone override parameter.
00238  *
00239  *    ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis    : Semi-major axis of ellipsoid, in meters       (output)
00240  *    ellipsoidFlattening       : Flattening of ellipsoid                       (output)
00241  *    override                  : UTM override zone, zero indicates no override (output)
00242  */
00243 
00244   return new UTMParameters( CoordinateType::universalTransverseMercator, UTM_Override );
00245 }
00246 
00247 
00248 MSP::CCS::UTMCoordinates* UTM::convertFromGeodetic( MSP::CCS::GeodeticCoordinates* geodeticCoordinates )
00249 {
00250 /*
00251  * The function convertFromGeodetic converts geodetic (latitude and
00252  * longitude) coordinates to UTM projection (zone, hemisphere, easting and
00253  * northing) coordinates according to the current ellipsoid and UTM zone
00254  * override parameters.  If any errors occur, an exception is thrown with a description 
00255  * of the error.
00256  *
00257  *    longitude         : Longitude in radians                (input)
00258  *    latitude          : Latitude in radians                 (input)
00259  *    zone              : UTM zone                            (output)
00260  *    hemisphere        : North or South hemisphere           (output)
00261  *    easting           : Easting (X) in meters               (output)
00262  *    northing          : Northing (Y) in meters              (output)
00263  */
00264 
00265   long Lat_Degrees;
00266   long Long_Degrees;
00267   long temp_zone;
00268   char hemisphere;
00269   double False_Northing = 0;
00270   char errorStatus[50] = "";
00271 
00272   double longitude = geodeticCoordinates->longitude();
00273   double latitude = geodeticCoordinates->latitude();
00274 
00275   if ((latitude < (MIN_LAT - EPSILON)) || (latitude >= (MAX_LAT + EPSILON)))
00276   { /* latitude out of range */
00277     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::latitude );
00278   }
00279   if ((longitude < -PI) || (longitude > (2*PI)))
00280   { /* longitude out of range */
00281     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::longitude );
00282   }
00283 
00284   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00285     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00286 
00287   if((latitude > -1.0e-9) && (latitude < 0))
00288     latitude = 0.0;
00289 
00290   if (longitude < 0)
00291     longitude += (2*PI) + 1.0e-10;
00292 
00293   Lat_Degrees = (long)(latitude * 180.0 / PI);
00294   Long_Degrees = (long)(longitude * 180.0 / PI);
00295 
00296   if (longitude < PI)
00297     temp_zone = (long)(31 + ((longitude * 180.0 / PI) / 6.0));
00298   else
00299     temp_zone = (long)(((longitude * 180.0 / PI) / 6.0) - 29);
00300 
00301   if (temp_zone > 60)
00302     temp_zone = 1;
00303 
00304   if (UTM_Override)
00305   {
00306     if ((temp_zone == 1) && (UTM_Override == 60))
00307       temp_zone = UTM_Override;
00308     else if ((temp_zone == 60) && (UTM_Override == 1))
00309       temp_zone = UTM_Override;
00310     else if (((temp_zone-1) <= UTM_Override) && (UTM_Override <= (temp_zone+1)))
00311       temp_zone = UTM_Override;
00312     else
00313       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::zoneOverride );
00314   }
00315 
00316   TransverseMercator transverseMercator = *transverseMercatorMap[temp_zone];
00317 
00318   if (latitude < 0)
00319   {
00320     False_Northing = 10000000;
00321     hemisphere = 'S';
00322   }
00323   else
00324     hemisphere = 'N';
00325 
00326   GeodeticCoordinates tempGeodeticCoordinates( CoordinateType::geodetic, longitude, latitude );
00327   MapProjectionCoordinates* transverseMercatorCoordinates = transverseMercator.convertFromGeodetic( &tempGeodeticCoordinates );
00328   double easting = transverseMercatorCoordinates->easting();
00329   double northing = transverseMercatorCoordinates->northing() + False_Northing;
00330 
00331   if ((easting < MIN_EASTING) || (easting > MAX_EASTING))
00332   {
00333     delete transverseMercatorCoordinates;
00334     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::easting );
00335   }
00336 
00337   if ((northing < MIN_NORTHING) || (northing > MAX_NORTHING))
00338   {
00339     delete transverseMercatorCoordinates;
00340     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::northing );
00341   }
00342 
00343   delete transverseMercatorCoordinates;
00344 
00345   return new UTMCoordinates( CoordinateType::universalTransverseMercator, temp_zone, hemisphere, easting, northing );
00346 }
00347 
00348 
00349 MSP::CCS::GeodeticCoordinates* UTM::convertToGeodetic( MSP::CCS::UTMCoordinates* utmCoordinates )
00350 {
00351 /*
00352  * The function convertToGeodetic converts UTM projection (zone,
00353  * hemisphere, easting and northing) coordinates to geodetic(latitude
00354  * and  longitude) coordinates, according to the current ellipsoid
00355  * parameters.  If any errors occur, an exception is thrown with a description 
00356  * of the error.
00357  *
00358  *    zone              : UTM zone                               (input)
00359  *    hemisphere        : North or South hemisphere              (input)
00360  *    easting           : Easting (X) in meters                  (input)
00361  *    northing          : Northing (Y) in meters                 (input)
00362  *    longitude         : Longitude in radians                   (output)
00363  *    latitude          : Latitude in radians                    (output)
00364  */
00365 
00366   double False_Northing = 0;
00367   char errorStatus[50] = "";
00368 
00369   long zone = utmCoordinates->zone();
00370   char hemisphere = utmCoordinates->hemisphere();
00371   double easting = utmCoordinates->easting();
00372   double northing = utmCoordinates->northing();
00373 
00374   if ((zone < 1) || (zone > 60))
00375     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::zone );
00376   if ((hemisphere != 'S') && (hemisphere != 'N'))
00377     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::hemisphere );
00378   if ((easting < MIN_EASTING) || (easting > MAX_EASTING))
00379     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::easting );
00380   if ((northing < MIN_NORTHING) || (northing > MAX_NORTHING))
00381     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::northing );
00382 
00383   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00384     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00385 
00386   TransverseMercator transverseMercator = *transverseMercatorMap[zone];
00387 
00388   if (hemisphere == 'S')
00389     False_Northing = 10000000;
00390 
00391   MapProjectionCoordinates transverseMercatorCoordinates( CoordinateType::transverseMercator, easting, northing - False_Northing );
00392   GeodeticCoordinates* geodeticCoordinates = transverseMercator.convertToGeodetic( &transverseMercatorCoordinates );
00393   geodeticCoordinates->setWarningMessage("");  
00394 
00395   double latitude = geodeticCoordinates->latitude();
00396 
00397   if ((latitude < (MIN_LAT - EPSILON)) || (latitude >= (MAX_LAT + EPSILON)))
00398   { /* latitude out of range */
00399     delete geodeticCoordinates;
00400     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::northing );
00401   }
00402 
00403   return geodeticCoordinates;
00404 }
